definition: speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: He's got mixed up with speculators.
sentences.chinese: 他跟投机倒把分子有瓜葛。

sentences.english: China’s leaders promise to hunt down and punish hoarders and speculators.
sentences.chinese: 中国领导人承诺严查和惩罚囤积居奇和投机倒把分子。

sentences.english: China's leaders promise to hunt down and punish hoarders and speculators.
sentences.chinese: 中国领导人承诺严查和惩罚囤积居奇和投机倒把分子。

sentences.english: There was a rift within the loot, as albert tennyson says.
sentences.chinese: 正如艾伯特丁尼生所说的，投机倒把里出现了裂罅。

sentences.english: Departments in charge of industry and commerce are authorized by the government to ban speculation and profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 政府授权工商部门严厉取缔投机倒把活动。

definition: to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
to speculate/to play the market/(fig.) to sell hot air/to swindle people by posing as a reputable operator
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
